This has led to increased social tension and violence, affecting social relationships and trust among members of the community. Estimates indicate that about one million Syrians (4%) of the population suffer from severe mental disorders, while 5% suffer from moderate mental disorders. It has also been found that 91.5% of children in the city of Damascus suffer from these disorders.

[Problem] المشكلة: الاحتكاك الثقافي
[Caused By] السبب: In the last year or so, several news agencies have written articles about the recent post-war “tourism boom” in Syria. Many of them claim that tourism in Syria is not ethical, seeing as tourist visits, especially those of influencers, amount to “whitewashing” the Syrian government, as claimed by The Washington Post. One of the most significant impacts of tourism is the erosion of traditional values, as local communities often prioritise tourist demands and revenue. Disrespectful tourist behaviour can further alienate host communities, discouraging younger generations from embracing their identity. Additionally, tourism can lead to the displacement of local populations, involving forced evictions, restricted access to resources, and the exploitation of natural assets. These practices prioritise profit at the expense of local communities, often dispossessing and marginalising the original inhabitants. The behaviors of tourists may conflict with the values or habits of society (such as dress, alcohol, disrespect for sanctities). It leads to conflicts between residents and visitors, and even between the population themselves (beneficiaries and non-beneficiaries).
[Caused By (Arabic)] خلال العام الماضي تقريبًا، نشرت عدة وكالات أنباء مقالات حول الطفرة السياحية التي شهدتها سوريا بعد الحرب. وزعم الكثيرون أن السياحة في سوريا غير أخلاقية، معتبرين أن الزيارات السياحية، وخاصةً زيارات المؤثرين، تُعدّ تبييضًا لصورة الحكومة السورية، كما زعمت صحيفة واشنطن بوست.
